data.strategy: You have a decent hand with moderate winning potential. Play carefully and consider your position and opponents' tendencies. Value bet when you believe you're ahead, but be prepared to fold to significant aggression. Look for cheap opportunities to see additional cards if you have drawing potential.
key_concepts: Consider pot odds when deciding whether to call or fold - compare your winning chances to the bet size relative to the pot.
Position is crucial - play more aggressively in late position where you have more information.
Balance your range by playing some medium-strength hands the same way you'd play strong hands.
Single pair hands decrease in value on boards with many straight or flush possibilities.
mistakes_to_avoid: Don't overcommit with a medium-strength hand when facing heavy resistance.
Avoid calling too many streets without a plan for the river.
Don't play too passively out of position - you need to show more strength when acting first.
Avoid making decisions based on emotions rather than mathematical and strategic considerations.
